meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive David Dickman Dale Butland Keith Bell Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #542.

td.p: David Dickman, a magazine editor from North Hollywood, California
Dale Butland, a press secretary originally from Columbus, Ohio (whose 1-day cash winnings total $2,000)
Keith Bell, a personnel specialist from Alexandria, Virginia (whose 2-day cash winnings total $15,901)

tr.td: SPORTS
SOAP OPERAS
4-LETTER WORDS
EUROPE
GIANTS
SUDDEN DEATH

softball

Keith
')

div.onmouseout:
toggle('clue_DJ_1_4', 'clue_DJ_1_4_stuck', '(Here comes the music.)

Bring the good old bugle, boys, we\'ll sing another song
Sing it with a spirit that will start the world along
Sing it as we used to sing it, 50,000 strong...

Civil War event depicted in this song:

...Hurrah! Hurrah! we bring the jubilee!
Hurrah! Hurrah! the flag that makes you free!')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td:
(Here comes the music.)
Bring the good old bugle, boys, we'll sing another song
Sing it with a spirit that will start the world along
Sing it as we used to sing it, 50,000 strong...
Civil War event depicted in this song:
...Hurrah! Hurrah! we bring the jubilee!
Hurrah! Hurrah! the flag that makes you free!

tr.td: ASTROLOGY
While Gemini is represented by 2 humans, this sign is represented by a pair of animals
Keith
Dale
David

2nd place: trip to New Orleans + stay at the Bienville House
3rd place: Daniel Mink watches
Keith
Dale
David

16 R
(including 2 DDs),
7 W
(including 1 DD)

2 W
